headline: Itâ€™s a trap... no advancement no faith in employees and bad managers
pros: Absolutely nothing, except for occasional catered lunches
cons: Low paycheck, unfair favoritism, drama filled office and long time employees who do and say whatever they want with no repercussions

headline: Intern
pros: Great atmosphere and employee sentiment. Beers on Fridays

headline: Excellent business plan in selling foreign exchange to corporations, but you need to make 75 to 100 cold calls a day.
pros: Laid back, compensation is good if you can bring a book of clients with you or are a great cold caller. Gary Chang managers the sales staff and is a stand up guy and treats everyone with respect.
cons: The senior foreign exchange salesmen are extremely under paid. They have expanded and paid higher salaries to the new comers. It's a very difficult environment when there's a two tier pay scale and the older staff know.  Terrible synergy among the sales staff and partners allow too much crap to slide by/

headline: Common Cronyism
pros: Good location with easy accessibility to subway. Midtown.
cons: Horrible culture, pretty much non existent due to the constant revolving door of sales staff. Low paying by industry standards A complete waste of my life from a company with changing objectives and direction  on a  monthly basis. Superficial on board training.
